required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Determine The Efficacy And Safety Of Tigecycline Compared With Imipenem/Cliastatin to Treat Complicated Intra-Abdominal Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Comparison Study Of The Efficacy And Safety Of Tigecycline To Imipenem/Cilastatin To Treat Complicated Intra-abdominal Infections In Hospitalized Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a comparative study of the efficacy and safety of tigecycline to imipenem/cilastatin in hospitalized patients with a complicated intra-abdominal infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the Test-of-Cure (TOC) Assessment Within the Clinically Evaluable (CE) Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
primary_outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
primary_outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Microbiologically Evaluable (ME) Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Response at the Subject Level in the ME Population at the TOC Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: The microbiological response at the subject level was described according to the following definitions of efficacy. Eradication (documented or presumed): none of the baseline pathogens were present in repeat intra-abdominal cultures from the original site of infection taken during the study or a clinical response of cure precluded the necessity of a repeat intra-abdominal culture. Persistence (documented or presumed): documented: any baseline intra-abdominal pathogen was present in the cultures obtained from the original site of the intra-abdominal abscess, peritonitis, or surgical wound infection during the study; Presumed: repeat microbiological data were not obtained for a participant with a clinical response of failure. Superinfection: Emergence of a new pathogen during therapy, at the site of infection with emergence or worsening of clinical signs and symptoms of infection.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) by Relationship and Seriousness
other_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study treatment through post therapy follow-up (28 days after the last dose of therapy)
other_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence without regard to causality in a participant who received study drug. A SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both AEs and Non-SAEs.

intervention.description: every 12 hours (an initial intravenous dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day approximately every 12 hours) and placebo intravenous doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial intravenous dose of tigecycline for at least for 5 days and up to 14 days.

every 6 hours intravenously, and the imipenem/cilastatin will be dosed by 500mg/500mg for the subjects with creatinine clearance equal or above 71ml/min/1.73m2 or dose will be adjusted by Schedule of Study Drug Administration for Subjects with Renal Impairment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized male or female subjects, at least 18 year of age.
- Complicated intra-abdominal infection is present at most under two weeks duration.
- Minimal clinical criteria at the time of intra-abdominal infection diagnosis or highly suspected intra-abdominal infection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anticipated length of antibiotic therapy less than 5 days or the likelihood that the subject will not complete the course of treatment.
- Intra-abdominal infection known to be caused by 1 or more bacterial pathogens not susceptible to both of the study drugs.
- Had accepted non-study antibiotics more than 24 hr within 72 hrs before enrollment except for subjects declared prior failures.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the total of 470 participants randomized, 235 were randomized to each treatment group. Seven participants (4 in tigecycline group and 3 in imipenem/cilastatin group) did not receive study treatment. One participant was randomized to imipenem/cilastatin group but received tigecycline and was reported and analyzed under the tigecycline group.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.title: Imipenem/Cilastatin
group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: No longer willing to participate study

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.title: Imipenem/Cilastatin
group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at the Test-of-Cure (TOC) Assessment Within the Clinically Evaluable (CE) Population
outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
outcome.population: The CE population was defined as all clinical modified intent-to-treat (c-mITT) participants who satisfied clinical evaluability criteria and had no major protocol violations.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.title: Imipenem/Cilastatin
group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

measure.title: Clinical Response at the Test-of-Cure (TOC) Assessment Within the Clinically Evaluable (CE) Population
measure.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
measure.population: The CE population was defined as all clinical modified intent-to-treat (c-mITT) participants who satisfied clinical evaluability criteria and had no major protocol violations.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Assuming that the 2 treatments were equally effective, with cure rates of 75 % at the TOC assessment, the study was powered to ensure with 90% probability that the lower limit of a 2-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for the true difference (tigecycline minus imipenem/cilastatin) in cure rates was greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Used the asymptotic method corrected for continuity with normal distribution approximation. Non-inferiority test was conducted on the CE population. If non-inferiority was concluded, superiority test was conducted on both the CE and mITT populations.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Microbiologically Evaluable (ME) Population
outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
outcome.population: The ME population was defined as all CE participants who satisfied the pre-specified ME evaluable criteria.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.title: Imipenem/Cilastatin
group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

measure.title: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Microbiologically Evaluable (ME) Population
measure.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
measure.population: The ME population was defined as all CE participants who satisfied the pre-specified ME evaluable criteria.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 2-sided CI for the difference in cure rates between treatment groups (tigecycline minus imipenem/cilastatin) was greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: CIs and p-values for between-group treatment difference in cure rate were calculated by the asymptotic method corrected for continuity with normal distribution approximation.

outcome.title: Microbiological Response at the Subject Level in the ME Population at the TOC Assessment
outcome.description: The microbiological response at the subject level was described according to the following definitions of efficacy. Eradication (documented or presumed): none of the baseline pathogens were present in repeat intra-abdominal cultures from the original site of infection taken during the study or a clinical response of cure precluded the necessity of a repeat intra-abdominal culture. Persistence (documented or presumed): documented: any baseline intra-abdominal pathogen was present in the cultures obtained from the original site of the intra-abdominal abscess, peritonitis, or surgical wound infection during the study; Presumed: repeat microbiological data were not obtained for a participant with a clinical response of failure. Superinfection: Emergence of a new pathogen during therapy, at the site of infection with emergence or worsening of clinical signs and symptoms of infection.
outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
outcome.population: The ME population was defined as all CE participants who satisfied the pre-specified ME evaluable criteria. n=number of participants with each microbiological response.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.title: Imipenem/Cilastatin
group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

measure.title: Microbiological Response at the Subject Level in the ME Population at the TOC Assessment
measure.description: The microbiological response at the subject level was described according to the following definitions of efficacy. Eradication (documented or presumed): none of the baseline pathogens were present in repeat intra-abdominal cultures from the original site of infection taken during the study or a clinical response of cure precluded the necessity of a repeat intra-abdominal culture. Persistence (documented or presumed): documented: any baseline intra-abdominal pathogen was present in the cultures obtained from the original site of the intra-abdominal abscess, peritonitis, or surgical wound infection during the study; Presumed: repeat microbiological data were not obtained for a participant with a clinical response of failure. Superinfection: Emergence of a new pathogen during therapy, at the site of infection with emergence or worsening of clinical signs and symptoms of infection.
measure.population: The ME population was defined as all CE participants who satisfied the pre-specified ME evaluable criteria. n=number of participants with each microbiological response.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 2-sided CI for the difference in eradication rates between treatment groups (tigecycline minus imipenem/cilastatin) was greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: CIs and p-values for between-group treatment difference in eradication rates were calculated by the asymptotic method corrected for continuity with normal distribution approximation.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) by Relationship and Seriousness
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence without regard to causality in a participant who received study drug. A SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both AEs and Non-SAEs.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study treatment through post therapy follow-up (28 days after the last dose of therapy)
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product. There was 1 participant (who was included in the safety population) had 7 AEs including 1 SAE which were identified after database release and were not reflected in the table.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) by Relationship and Seriousness
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence without regard to causality in a participant who received study drug. A SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both AEs and Non-SAEs.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product. There was 1 participant (who was included in the safety population) had 7 AEs including 1 SAE which were identified after database release and were not reflected in the table.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
outcome.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 14 or last day of therapy (treatment duration was at least 5 days and up to 14 days), and TOC (14-21 days after the last dose of therapy)
outcome.population: The MITT population was defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product.

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

group.description: Participants were administered with imipenem/cilastatin (approximately 100-mL IV infusion) intravenously approximately every 6 hours. IV placebo (100 mL of normal saline) was required to be dosed immediately After the first dose of imipenem/cilastatin.

measure.title: Clinical Response at the TOC Assessment Within the Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population
measure.description: The clinical response was to be determined by the investigator and was classified as 1 of the following: cure (relevant clinical signs and symptoms of infection at baseline disappeared or recovered to normal and relevant non microbiological results of laboratory tests returned to normal level or the resolution of signs and symptoms so that at no further therapy was required), failure (participant required additional surgical or radiologic intervention and/or received additional anti-infection therapy to cure the infection since administration of study drug until TOC; or death after study Day 2 due to the infection or a treatment related AE or discontinuation due to a treatment related AE or received greater than 120% of the prescribed number of investigational product doses), or indeterminate (lost to follow-up; or died within 2 days after the first dose of study drug for any reason; or died after study Day 2 but prior to the TOC assessment because of non infection related reasons).
measure.population: The MITT population was defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 2-sided CI for the difference in cure rates between treatment groups (tigecycline minus imipenem/cilastatin) was greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Used the asymptotic method corrected for continuity with normal distribution approximation. Non-inferiority test was conducted on the CE population. If non-inferiority was concluded, superiority test was conducted on both the CE and mITT populations.

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose of study treatment (for non-serious AEs)/the time that the subject provided informed consent (for SAEs) through post therapy follow-up (28 days after the last dose of therapy)

group.title: Tigecycline 50mg
group.description: Participants were administered with tigecycline every 12 hours (an initial intravenous [IV] dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg twice a day [BID] approximately every 12 hours) and placebo (100-mL of normal saline) IV doses every 12 hours beginning 6 hours after the initial IV dose of tigecycline.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
